alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 6:22PM EST until February 27 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At McConnelsville affecting Washington and Morgan Counties. For the Muskingum River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River At McConnelsville. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.6 feet, Most primary roads flooded in and between McConnelsville and Zanesville; several cottage-type homes are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM EST Tuesday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.8 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.8 feet on 03/23/1927. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 615 AM EST.
